m_szDocSumamry: Click to email (Opens in new window) Share: Toyota has been working on developing fuel-cell technology for almost as long as I’ve been alive. The company began experimenting with alternatively fueled vehicles in 1992, and the first product to emerge was the hybrid gas-and-electric-fueled Prius in 1997. But it wasn’t until late 2014 that Toyota unveiled what it sees as the next step in the future of sustainable mobility: The hydrogen-fueled Toyota Mirai.
